results.title: Jan Stephenson's How to Golf
results.brief_description: How to Golf is a 50 minute cassette that addresses each and every aspect of the game of golf, from driving off the tee to effective hazard play. Each segment is colour coded for easy referral to the areas of your game that need work most. Suitable for male and female golf enthusiasts of all ages and abilities, starring one of the most recognisable sports personalities world-wide - Jan Stephenson.

results.title: Spotlights: Jan Chapman
results.brief_description: Jan Chapman is an Australian film producer, who has produced some of our most beloved and critically acclaimed films, including The Last Days of Chez Nous (1992), The Piano (1993), Love Serenade (1996), Holy Smoke! (1999) and Lantana (2001).

constellations_primary.name: Jan Chapman
constellations_primary.description: From an independent Sydney cinema to the world's stage, Jan Chapman's work has many connections to the Australian film scene and Hollywood.

results.title: Jamon jamon [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lola Films, Ovideo TV, Andres Gomes and Jose Bigas Luna
results.brief_description: Bigas Luna co-wrote and directed “Jamon jamon”, which stars Penelope Cruz and Javier Bardem, both Spanish actors who would go on to achieve fame in America. “Jamon jamon” is a comedy/drama set in the arid region of Monegros, Spain. Jose Luis is a young executive working in an underwear factory, run by his overbearing mother and passive father. Luis is having a relationship with a factory girl Silvia (Cruz) who is pregnant with his child. Jose’s mother Conchita, is horrified by the thought of her son marrying anyone at all, let alone a factory worker whose mother is a prostitute. Conchita sets about scuttling her son’s plans by hiring Raul, a handsome would be bullfighter to woo Silvia. Complications ensue all round as Conchita takes a liking to Raul herself and Jose cannot pass up his fondness for sleeping with Silvia’s mother (who also has a past history with Jose’s father). “Jamon jamon” is a film about sex, love, infidelity, passion, loyalty and family. Heavy symbolism reflects a macho culture driven by male desire for assuaging of ego and ratification of sexual prowess. Features numerous erotic heterosexual scenes. Winner of the Silver Lion at the 1992 Venice Film Festival.

results.title: Jamieson Primary School
results.brief_description: The town of Jamieson, in north-eastern Victoria, is fiercely proud and protective of its historical primary school. With a school population hanging on for dear life, they understand only too well how much a primary school is the beating heart of a small community. It is also a place where life-long friendships are forged, and the school community (past and present) come together here to reflect on the ties that bind them to Jamieson. Principal Genevieve Bolwell also discusses the exciting school programs, which will take the next generation into the future.

results.title: Jamie: the story of a sibling
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and John Howe
results.brief_description: The film shows how the emotional development of children is affected by parental attitudes and by competition for parental attention. Jamie in this film is a ten-year-old, an age when it hurts if you fail to win a parent’s approval, or if you must give way because you are the youngest in the family. Parents who want to know what goes on inside a child’s mind will find Jamie, and the family of which he is part, a provocative, revealing study. Intended for discussion purposes by only depicting the situation. Cast: Ron Cahoon, James Dougal, Jill Foster, Danny McIlravey, Paula McKeown.

results.title: Jamie: a behavioural approach to family intervention (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles. Media Center and J Loebsen
results.brief_description: Jamie is a pre-school child whose behaviour problems disturb his family life. Jamies’ parents discuss with a therapist their response to Jamie’s behaviour and the benefits of the classes they attend, which provide a program to modify both Jamie’s actions and his parents attitude to his behaviour.

results.title: Jamie, Ethan and Marlon: the first two months
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Child”.
He has just made his debut into the world. How does he shape up? In this first film, a pediatrician explains what he looks for when he gives a newborn infant his first physical checkup—testing reflexes, muscle tone, eye movement, etc. Three babies are observed, first in hospital, then at home in the care of their parents.

results.title: Jamie, Ethan and Keir: 2-14 months
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Child”.
The world at toddler’s eye level. For months a baby lies in his crib looking at all those things just beyond his reach. Then he learns to move about, to crawl, to stand and suddenly all those things are his to touch, to taste. This film observes a baby’s natural curiosity, his way of “getting into things” as part of the experience of learning and adapting. Differences in behaviour of the three babies are noted.

results.title: Jamie Oliver: Pukka tukka
results.creator_credit: Video Collection International, Jamie Oliver and Brian Klein
results.brief_description: Naked chef Jamie Oliver challenges the notion that fast food is easier and cheaper than any pucker tucker. Pitting his culinary skills against leading brands of instant meals, he creates his own variations on pasta, salmon, and an apple and blackberry crumble to prove that he comes in quicker and cheaper with home variations. Jamie also finds time to drop in on friends with a variety of backgrounds and budgets, in Coventry, Manchester and London and creates a range of dishes including: slow-roasted leg of pork with spicy scratching; sticky chocolate sauce pudding; celeriac and potato gratin; tray baked field mushrooms with garlic, butter and thyme; apricot and pistachio tarte tatin; sea bass with fennel and olives; white risotto with lemon thyme, sliced prosciutto, pecorino, parmesan and crumbled goats cheese. He also outlines the vital ingredients of a pantry.
